inclusion.criterion: If the patient agrees to participate, CTU staff will obtain consent.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: The patient will be assigned a participant number.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: The Fetal Life tocometer will be applied to the patient's lower abdomen in addition to the standard tocometer used on Labor and Delivery and secured with the monitor belt by CTU staff
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: The Fetal Life tocometer will be paired the study iPad and output will be captured by CTU staff
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: The patient will be asked to cough in order to create a peak that synchronizes the graphic output of the Fetal Life tocometer and the standard tocometer
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: The patient will be monitored with the both the standard tocometer and the Fetal Life tocometer for 45-60 minutes
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: If the maternal or fetal status requires changes of maternal position during the trial, the Fetal Life monitor may be left in place, disconnected from the iPad or removed from the patient, whichever is least disruptive, so as not to interfere with the patient's obstetrical care in any way
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: CTU staff will document patient's age, parity, estimated gestational age and body mass index on a data collection sheet identified by participant number. No personal health information will be maintained on the data sheet.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: If 45-60 minutes of monitoring is not completed, CTU staff will document the reason why
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Patient will complete a brief survey on monitor comfort in comparison to the standard monitor
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Image files from the standard tocometry fetal monitoring system will be exported for comparison with the output of the Fetal Life tocometer.
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Any active skin lesions or infections
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: Patient has a severe 'exploding' headache and was diagnosed with an AVM. She refused PT evaluation but was ambulating independently without difficulty.
